comment: Transferrd on December 19, 2014; it has a " wild" Belgian aroma with very little if any hop aroma; the flavor has the wild "sneaky" Belgian character of having a big alcohol boom; however, no fusel flavors; it's very tasty, let's see how it carbonates.

The carbonation on February 9, 2015 is perfect! The aroma is a barn-yard smell, Earthy aromas dominate, no hop or malt aroma detected; the color is a hazy amber-brown, the flavor is much like a high ABV Belgian ale like Chimay or Duvel: full mouth-feel, warming finish. Too bad it just stinks like a chicken-coop/
